Package net.xqhs.flash.local

Class LocalPylon

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xqhs.util.config.Config
      • net.xqhs.util.logging.Unit
        • net.xqhs.flash.core.support.DefaultPylonImplementation
          • net.xqhs.flash.local.LocalPylon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, ConfigurableEntity<Node>, Entity<Node>, RunnableEntity<Node>, Pylon, net.xqhs.util.config.Configurable
    public class LocalPylon
extends DefaultPylonImplementation
implements RunnableEntity<Node>
    Simple support implementation that allows agents to send messages locally (inside the same JVM) based simply on agent name.

    Messages with destination which have not yet been registered (undeliverable messages) will be discarded.

    There are two ways in which this implementation can work.

    In the direct method (when a thread is not used), the send(String, String, String) leads directly to a call of the MessageReceiver.receive(String, String, String) method of the shard in the destination agent.

    In the queued method, a thread is used (as configured by means of the USE_THREAD_PARAM_NAME parameter in the configuration), which processes a queue to which messages are added, and from which messages are taken to be delivered.

    Warning: in this method, the send(String, String, String) always returns true, but it is no guaranteed that the message has reached its destination.

    TODO: implement keeping undeliverable messages (see KEEP_UNDELIVERABLE_PARAM_NAME and RETRY_EVERY_PARAM_NAME).

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

        public static final java.lang.String KEEP_UNDELIVERABLE_PARAM_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String RETRY_EVERY_PARAM_NAME

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • useThread

        protected boolean useThread
        If true, a separate thread will be used to buffer messages. Otherwise, only method calling will be used.

        If a thread is used, MessagingPylonProxy.send(String, String, String) will always return true.

        WARNING: not using a thread may lead to race conditions and deadlocks. Use only if you know what you are doing.

      • keepUndeliverable

        protected int keepUndeliverable
        Indicates whether the messages where the destination is not known should be kept and delivery should be retried. The value of the parameter indicates the number of retries (see LocalSupport for more details).

      • retryEvery

        protected int retryEvery
        Indicates how often delivery should be retried for messages.

      • messageReceivers

        protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​MessageReceiver> messageReceivers
        The receivers for each agent.

      • messageThread

        protected java.lang.Thread messageThread
        If a separate thread is used for messages (useThread is true) this is a reference to that thread.

      • messageQueue

        protected java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> messageQueue
        If a separate thread is used for messages (useThread is true) this queue is used to gather messages.

      • start

        public boolean start()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Starts the life-cycle of the entity. If this goes well, from this moment on the entity should be executing normally.

        The method must guarantee that once it has been started successfully, the entity can immediately begin receiving events, even if those events will not be processed immediately.

        The method should return immediately. It is not guaranteed that when the method returned, the entity has successfully started; this should checked using Entity.isRunning().

        Specified by:
        start in interface Entity<Node>
        Overrides:
        start in class DefaultPylonImplementation
        Returns:
        true if the entity was started without error. false otherwise.

      • send

        protected boolean send​(java.lang.String source,
                       java.lang.String destination,
                       java.lang.String content)
        Registered that a message must be sent. If a thread and a queue are not used, this method directly calls deliver(String, String, String).
        Parameters:
        source - - the source (complete) endpoint of the message.
        destination - - the target (complete) endpoint of the message.
        content - - the content of the message.
        Returns:
        true if the message was sent successfully or if a thread is used.

        Specified by:

      • addGeneralContext

        public boolean addGeneralContext​(Entity.EntityProxy<?> context)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Creates a link from a subordinate entity to an entity containing it in some way.

        This method should only be used (as opposed to Entity.addContext(net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<P>) in the following cases:

        • when a context other than the direct parent of the entity is added; or
        • when the caller cannot know the exact type of the entity's parent; and
        • passing as argument an entity of the appropriate type is not possible.

        It is the responsibility of the called object to verify the correctness of the argument.

        The recommended implementation for this method is one that calls Entity.addContext(EntityProxy) after casting the argument to the appropriate type, optionally catching ClassCastException and returning false if such an exception occurs.

        This method should be idempotent (when called with the same argument): adding the same context multiple times (with no Entity.removeContext(net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<P>) operations in between) should have no effect.

        Specified by:
        addGeneralContext in interface Entity<Node>
        Overrides:
        addGeneralContext in class DefaultPylonImplementation
        Parameters:
        context - - a reference to the higher-level entity.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful. false otherwise.
